Charles R. Drew University of Medicine and Science

general_texts:
• About the Bachelor of Science in Biomedical Sciences
  • BMS Admission Requirements
  • Apply to the BMS program

General Information about the Biomedical Sciences B.S. degree:

  • The Bachelor of Science degree in Biomedical Sciences prepares students for entry into graduate and professional programs in medicine, osteopathic, podiatry, optometry, physical therapy, physician assistant, pharmacy or dentistry. In addition, the BS-BMS program prepares students for masterâ€™s and doctoral programs, scientific research, and employment in biomedical laboratories and/or biotech companies. The program offers a multidisciplinary study of health and diseases, and particularly the biological and molecular sciences that constitute the foundation of modern medicine. 
  • The maximum transfer credit: 63 units
  • Approximate time to completion: ~8 semesters

names.name: Charles R. Drew University of Medicine and Science

general_texts:
This program is ideal for two types of students:

  1. Students who have not yet completed 52 units of transferable college coursework. This unique track, ideal for first-time college students, provides the foundational coursework and prerequisites necessary for upper division nursing coursework.
  2. Students who have completed most of the prerequisites and are almost ready to begin upper division nursing coursework.


In-residency coursework:

  • Starting in Fall 2025, pre-nursing students must complete two in-residency courses as part of their prerequisites in order to transition into upper division nursing coursework.


Prerequisites that can be transferred:

  • College Algebra (3 units)
  • Intro/General Chemistry w/ Lab (4 units)
  • Intro/General Microbiology w/ Lab (4 units)
  • Human Anatomy w/ Lab (4 units)
  • Human Physiology w/ Lab (4 units)
  • Intro/General Biology w/o Lab (4 units)
  • English Composition (3 units)
  • English Critical Thinking (3 units)
  • Public Speaking (3 units)
  • Intro/General to Sociology (3 units)
  • Intro/General Psychology (3 units)
  • Creative Arts (3 units)
  • 1. Humanities (3 units)
  • 2. Humanities (3 units)

• About the Bachelor of Science in Nursing
  • Apply to the Pre-Nursing Track

names.name: Charles R. Drew University of Medicine and Science

general_texts:
General Information about the Psychology B.S. degree:

  • The Bachelor of Science in Psychology with an Emphasis in Community Counseling program equips students for roles in mental and behavioral health counseling within diverse and underserved communities. This program prepares students not only for immediate employment in mental health fields but also provides a strong foundation for graduate studies in psychology, public health, social work, education, and various medical and nursing programs. Additionally, coursework may fulfill requirements for a range of healthcare certifications and advanced degrees.
  • Approximate time to completion: ~8 semesters


Curriculum and Transfer credit information:

  • The program includes 12 units of psychology elective coursework outside of the required program courses (can be transferred)
  • The program includes 20 units of general elective credit (can be transferred)
  • Maximum transfer credit: 60 units

• About the Bachelor of Science in Psychology
  • BS in Psychology Admission Requirements
  • Apply to BS Psychology

names.name: Charles R. Drew University of Medicine and Science

general_texts:
General information about the Bachelor of Science in Public Health Program

  • The CDU Bachelor of Science in Public Health (BSPH) program in Urban Health Disparities provides the next generation of scholars, public health practitioners, and future clinicians a rich educational foundation which integrates theoretical, applied, and social justice knowledge to public health research, practice, and policy. 
  • The BSPH program offers a public health curriculum through a social justice lens that integrates the foundational public health domains, knowledge, skills, and research experience. The BSPH program curriculum enhances our graduatesâ€™ ability to translate and apply the newly gained public health knowledge and skills to public health practice, graduate and clinical programs. Our program faculty provides a supportive and accessible learning environment to engage critically with course materials and share opportunities to gain hands-on experience.
  • Maximum time for degree completion for freshmen is 8 Years 
  • Maximum transfer credit: 75 units

• About the Bachelor of Science in Public Health Program
  • Admission Requirements
  • Apply to BS in Public Health

names.name: Charles R. Drew University of Medicine and Science

general_texts:
General Information about the Associate of Science, Radiologic Technology Program

  • The Associate of Science in Radiologic Technology program is a 21-month program that combines didactic instruction with practical experience, providing a sound foundation on which to build a career. Student radiographers are educated in the art and science of using radiation to provide images of tissues, organs, bones and blood vessels of the human body. Our program offers students the unique opportunity to experience all facets of radiology imaging. The core program revolves around clinical and didactic training.
  • Admission Requirements: Completion of Medical Terminology and Anatomy & Physiology
  • Transfer Credit: Students are encouraged to transfer in the general education courses required for the AS Radiologic Technology Program. More information can be found at the links below.

• About the Associate of Science, Radiologic Technology Program
  • Admission Requirements
  • Apply to AS in Radiologic Technology
